RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 79. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. INNER TURF (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA). For Maidens, Two Years Old Weight, 119 lbs.(Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GLOBAL PERSPECTIVE came away in good order, dropped from the four path to the two path on the first turn, stalked the leader on the outside, was asked early on the far turn, inched closer to the leader under a strong hand-ride, came under a left-handed crop in upper stretch, took the advantage coming to the furlong marker then drove clear in the final sixteenth to prove best. REAL MEN VIOLIN bumped lightly with a foe at the start, raced in the three path on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, was asked early on the far turn then chased three wide, pursued the leader under a drive in the stretch, kept on to the finish and just got up for the place. FELTRINELLI was hustled to the front, dropped from the two path to the rail on the first turn, was well rated while showing the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the final turn, was asked with three furlongs to run, came under a right-handed crop in upper stretch, lost the advantage approaching the furlong marker and weakened then lost the place near the wire but was clear for the show. RADIO LIBERTY was hustled from the start, showed speed on the inside of a foe, was taken back under strong restraint while saving ground midway through the first turn, was rated just off the pace, came under urging at the seven-sixteenths, chased inside through the far turn and tired. VERACRUZIN broke a step slow then was carried in, went three then four wide on the first turn, tugged hard on the bit under snug restraint onto the backstretch, was reserved between foes, went three then four wide while let out then roused on the far turn, chased into the stretch and came up empty. SHERIFF JOE made light contact with a foe at the start then came inward, went five wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused near the seven-sixteenths, went four then five wide on the far turn and capitulated. INHERENT PROMISE went around the first turn in the two path, was reserved off the pace, came under urging leaving the backstretch, traveled around the far turn in the two path, dropped back in upper stretch and had nothing left.

ENTRY.NAME: Radio Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Spendthrift Farm LLC Schwartz Martin S Gandharvi LLC Big Easy Racing LLC Kanter
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,taken back ins,rated,ask7/16,chased ins2nd turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Inherent Promise
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,reserved,ask7/16,urged 2p2nd turn,drop back3/16,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Feltrinelli
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable and Radcliffe Kerri
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,2p-ins1st,pace,ins2nd,ask3/8,headed1/8,wknd,lost2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Veracruzin
ENTRY.OWNER: Mackin Craig Mims Ted O and Pollard Kevin J
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slw,carried in,3-4p1st,pulled,rated,let out3-4p2nd,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff Joe
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,came in,5w1st,settled out,ask7/16,4-5w2nd,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Real Men Violin
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,3p1st,trckd out,chsd 3p2nd,willingly for place

ENTRY.NAME: Global Perspective
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-2p1st,stlkd outside,ask2nd turn,bid,strong drive,lead1/8,clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 35000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Clai m Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VAX chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the half mile pole, went four wide through the turn and five to six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was up in the late stages to prevail. TRUST THE NUMBERS showed the way in hand along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was caught in the very late stages to the finish while well clear of the rest for the place honors. HANDLE THE TRUTH coaxed from the start, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, improved position to the finish to procure the show honors. QUICK POWER NAP three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and weakened. LA AGUILILLA chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn getting placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch, tired, then took a bad step just after the finish and was pulled up and subsequently vanned off. GOODBYE KYLE chased five wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. OUR ROSIE DIAMONDS coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then five wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, went eight wide into upper stretch and tired. MO TOWN MADISON forwardly placed just off the inside in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing midway on the turn, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Handle the Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 7/16, angled 5-6w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: La Aguililla
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 3w 3/8, 7w upper, tired, pulled up, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Vax
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 1/2p, 4w turn, 5-6w uppr, dug in, up last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Our Rosie Diamonds
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 5w 7/16, 8w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Trust the Numbers
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, dug in, caught, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Town Madison
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed 2p, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Goodbye Kyle
ENTRY.OWNER: David A Bernsen LLC and Lambert Jeffrey
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Quick Power Nap
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Smart N Fancy S. SARATOGA RACE 3 5 1/2F Turf CR: 102. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided accordingly $82,500 to the winner, $30,000 to s econd, $18,000 to third, $9,000 to fourth, $6,000 to fifth and $4,500 divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstake on the turf in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake on the turf in 2022 allowed 4 lbs.; o f three races on the turf other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance allowed 6 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the main track. Closed Satu
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSES FOR DEBRA veered out at the start, settled comfortably on the outside, went three wide while confidently handled on the turn, was roused while shifting four wide late on that bend, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed fast under a strong hand-ride to get the lead inside the three-sixteenths, kicked clear under one tap of a down-turned crop inside the furlong marker and powered away while put to a very mild hand ride. BUBBLE ROCK was taken back off the pace under stout restraint then stalked the leader, ranged up in the three path on the turn, made an outside bid at the five-sixteenths, was asked coming to the quarter-pole then driven four wide into the stretch, passed the three-sixteenths on even terms for the lead, battled under a drive in the final furlong and proved no match for the winner while able to get the place. TRAIN TO ARTEMUS was hustled to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked late on that bend, spun three wide into the stretch under heavy pressure, lost the advantage near the three-sixteenths, fought under a drive into the final furlong and weakened. TALKIN TIPSY broke out at the start, was reserved on the outside, angled in late on the backstretch, was roused while inside on the turn, turned into the stretch in the two path and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Bubble Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,taken back,stlkd,3p turn,bid5/16,4p1/4,no match,earned2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Train to Artemus
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to front,pace,2p turn,asked,3p1/4,headed ins3/16,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Roses for Debra
ENTRY.OWNER: Cheyenne Stable LLC and O'Meara John
ENTRY.COMMENT: veer out brk,settled out,3w,ask ins5/16,4w,rally 5w1/4,power away

ENTRY.NAME: Talkin Tipsy
ENTRY.OWNER: Gulick James M Crown's Way Racing LLC Stevens Louis F and Johnson Richard James
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,reserved outside,mvd in ins1/2,ins turn,2p1/4,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 99. Claiming Purse 64000. INNER TURF (UP TO $11,136 NYSBFOA). For Four Year Olds and Upward Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. ; Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $32,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $25,000 Or Le ss Not Considered In Allowances)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRUCULENT coaxed from the gate, chased three wide from just off the pace coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, floated out under a left handed crop three paths straightened away, rallied to take narrow command a furlong out, dug in tussling head to head with STYNER, had the rider switch the crop to the right hand when headed narrowly a sixteenth from home, came in bumping STYNER seventy yards out, then brushed forty yards from home and again brushed steps from the wire all under a right handed crop and just got up in the very last jump. STYNER established the front into the backstretch and showed the way in hand along the inside, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside at the quarter pole, floated out three paths straightened away and under threat to the outside, dug in and was headed a furlong out, fought on knocking heads to the finish being flashed a right handed stick, took back command narrowly a sixteenth from home, then got bumped and brushed twice through to the finish by his main danger and was ultimately bested on the wire. JUST CALL RAY chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, ran on to secure the show honors. LANDBISCUIT four wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, kept on to the finish and was just bested for the show honors. DUST DEVIL chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung three wide for home, stayed on one paced to the finish. HIGH TIDE chased three wide early on and then four to five wide through the far turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung six wide into upper stretch and made no late headway. DATESFREEDOM chased along the inside and then three wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, made no impact. TOMMY BEE coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch and folded. There was a Stewards' Inquiry into the stretch run as well as a claim of foul by the rider of STYNER alleging interference against TRUCULENT in the stretch. After review, the claim of foul was dismissed and the result was allowed to stand prior to the race being declared official.

ENTRY.NAME: High Tide
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w backstretch, coaxed 4-5w 3/8, 6w upper, no late headway

ENTRY.NAME: Landbiscuit
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, angled 5-6w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Tommy Bee
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 7/16, 2-3w upper, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Styner
ENTRY.OWNER: Kasey K Racing Stable LLC and Final Turn Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins, 2w 1/4p, floated out, headed 1/8, up 1/16, bumped, brushed

ENTRY.NAME: Just Call Ray
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Truculent
ENTRY.OWNER: Krakow Racing LLC SOK Racing and Politano James
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3w pursuit, 4w uppr, up 1/8, bump, brush foe, up

ENTRY.NAME: Datesfreedom
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed 3w 7/16, angled 6w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Dust Devil
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, one paced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 92. Claiming Purse 88000. (UP TO $15,312 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $75,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $50,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAJOR BLUE was hustled from the gate, angled in while going to the front and carried in two rivals in the process, showed the way down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the turn, spun three wide into the stretch then dropped back in some, fought with the runner-up into the final furlong and edged clear under steady urging. DARK VECTOR was hustled from the gate, pressed the pace on the outside, reached even terms for the lead near the nine-sixteenths, vied in the four path on the turn, was urged in the five path into the stretch, battled outside the winner into the final furlong and was outfinished while able to get the place. MR BOB was taken in hand while carried in early, settled in a good position just off the pace, chased in the three path on the turn, kept on in pursuit of the top two in the stretch and narrowly earned the show. THUNDERIAN bumped with a rival at the start, was urged along off the pace, moved in inside the five-eighths pole, shifted from four to six wide on the turn, came seven wide into the stretch, was corrected while leaning in towards a foe around the three-sixteenths, lugged in a touch under a left-handed crop and improved to just miss the show while flagged with the crop late and narrowly earned the final spot in the superfecta. WARRIOR RICHARD checked while in tight between horses early, was urged well off the pace, angled from the rail to the five path on the turn, came eight wide into the stretch and improved to just miss the superfecta. ALTERNATE REALITY broke out then bumped with foes on both sides, was bounced around then taken up while pinched back, raced at the rear under urging, moved from the rail to the two path on the turn and was no factor. PROVE RIGHT was urged along off the pace, saved ground early on the turn, angled three wide late on that bend, turned into upper stretch under a drive and came up empty. HELDISH was coaxed along on the outside, chased the five path on the turn, spun six wide into the stretch and tired. JOKING WAY bumped with a rival at the start then was hustled, was carried in early, pressed the pace on the inside of foes, dropped back near the nine-sixteenths, chased inside on the turn and capitulated. STREET SWAGG broke out then bumped with a foe to his inside, was urged along off the pace, went three wide on the turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Prove Right
ENTRY.OWNER: Two B and One C Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,ins-3path turn,driven past 1/4,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior Richard
ENTRY.OWNER: AB Racing LLC and Crown Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight after brk,checked,urged,angled 5w turn,8w1/4,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Alternate Reality
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,bmpd btwn,bounced around,squeezed,ins-2p,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Street Swagg
ENTRY.OWNER: Anthony George Emerald Upstate Stable Roman Lawrence P CT Racing and Danzuso Alf
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,urged along,3wide turn,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderian
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,urged along,mvd in 4-1/2,4-6w turn,7w1/4,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Joking Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,carried in early,pressed ins,chased rail turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Bob
ENTRY.OWNER: John Grossi's Racing Corp Beast Mode Racing LLC and Falcone Jr Robert N
ENTRY.COMMENT: carried in early,taken in hand,well placed,chased 3p turn,kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Major Blue
ENTRY.OWNER: Ghent Bob Ghent Ann Lukas Laurie and Lukas D Wayne
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,angled in,pace,2path turn,3p1/4,drop in,clear final 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Dark Vector
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable Gatsas Stables RAP Racing and Mara Chris
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,press out,vied 4p turn,5p1/4,fought past1/8,outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Heldish
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael Paradise Farms Corp Staudacher David and Caruso Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed outside,chased 5path turn,6path into lane,tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 79. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIERCENESS coaxed lightly from the gate to the front, got displaced by CHANGE OF COMMAND and settled latched on three wide to the outside of that rival before advancing to take over at the nine-sixteenths, tucked to the two path into the turn and was lightly coaxed when BILLAL advanced outside, shook off that rival nearing the quarter pole and swung four wide into upper stretch, got placed to a light brief drive and went clear to inside the eighth pole, had the rider sneak a peek at the infield screen and was geared down and back in hand through the final sixteenth to the finish still widening away to the finish. AIR OF DEFIANCE lunged at the start, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one and improved position to secure the place honors. BILLAL coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide advancing to briefly latch on the top one midway on the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung two to three wide into upper stretch shaken off and kept on to the finish to secure the show honors. CHANGE OF COMMAND broke in step at the start, established the front shortly after and showed the way briefly along the inside until displaced by FIERCENESS with nine-sixteenths to go, chased along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. DAILY GRIND hustled from the gate, chased five to six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four then three wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch and weakened. ANCHISES chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coaxed along from the seven-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. APOLLO TEN chased three to four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and tired. WAJDA shied in at the start, chased just off the inside just off the pace, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Air of Defiance
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, cut corner, no match, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Anchises
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 2p 7/16, angled 4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Apollo Ten
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Wajda
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied in st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Change of Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in step st, led early ins, chased ins, inside 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Fierceness
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w early, up 9/16, 2p turn, 4w uppr, went clear, geared down

ENTRY.NAME: Billal
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, advanced 3/8, 2-3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Daily Grind
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, 5-6w backstretch, 4-3w turn, 4w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment D ue At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONTHEONESANDTWOS quickly sped clear, dictated terms in the two path through the turn, extended the advantage into upper stretch and drew off while kept to the task. HEADLAND pressed then chased the pace on the inside of the leader, moved out near the half-mile pole, chased in the three path on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and proved no match for the winner while just able to hold the place. YOU LOOK COLD settled on the inside, angled from the rail to the five path on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and just missed the place while well clear for the show. EASY TO BLESS settled on the outside, was roused three then four wide on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and came up empty. HYDRA was coaxed along off the pace, dropped from the two path to the rail on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: You Look Cold
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,angled ins-5path turn,5w into lane,just missed place

ENTRY.NAME: Headland
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed,chased,mvd out 1/2,3path turn,no match,held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Hydra
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along,2path-inside turn,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Easy to Bless
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,roused 3-4wide turn,mvd out 3/16,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Ontheonesandtwos
ENTRY.OWNER: Pura Vida Investments LLC Hutson Cindy M Madaket Stables LLC and Romano Thomas J
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed way,clear1/2,2path turn,responded,drew off,kept to task

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Purse 149500. INNER TURF (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA). For Fillies And Mares Three Years Old and Upward Which Have Never Won $18,000 Other Than Maiden, Claiming, Starter Or State Bred Allowance or Which Have Never Won Two Races. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs . Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANATOLIAN just off the inside through the first turn, chased three wide from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, drifted out three paths straightened away, dug in under a drive rallying to collar the top pair a sixteenth from home, then edged away to the finish kept to task. PEAK POPULARITY three wide through the first turn, chased four wide from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung four wide into upper stretch, issued a challenge knocking heads from upper stretch to the sixteenth marker taking narrow command inside the eighth pole before being caught a sixteenth out, then ran on clear for the place honors. SHE CAUGHT MY EYE four then three wide through the opening bend, chased four then three wide advancing to take command just inside the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home, dug in dueling and was caught inside the eighth pole, then weakened in the late stages while well clear for the show honors. RUN DEVIL dueled three then two wide with OUT OF SIGHT to her inside, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, got displaced from the front just inside the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened. MODERN LOVE chased along the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. EMBRACE ME bobbled at the break, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the half mile pole, tipped out to be four wide at the three-eighths, continued three to four wide for home and tired. OUT OF SIGHT broke out at the start trading a bump with SWEET DUTCHESS, dueled inside of RUN DEVIL coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and tired. SWEET DUTCHESS broke in at the start trading a bump with the aforementioned foe, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the half mile pole, swung four wide for home and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Embrace Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, chased ins, coaxed 1/2, tip 4w 3/8, 3-4w uppr, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Anatolian
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 7/16, 6w upper, dug in, up 1/16, edged away

ENTRY.NAME: Out of Sight
ENTRY.OWNER: Iselin James L and Gilman Mark P
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, dueled ins, coaxed 3/8, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Dutchess
ENTRY.OWNER: Pantofel Stable LLC Wachtel Stable and Barber Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 2p, coaxed 1/2, angled 4w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Modern Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 7/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Peak Popularity
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 1st turn, chased 4w, 4w upper, up ins 1/8, collared, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: She Caught My Eye
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w 1st turn, chased 4-3w, up 5/16, 3w upper, caught, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Run Devil
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, yielded ins 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Personal Ensign S. - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 9 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 110. Stakes Purse 500000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $500 each which should accompany the nomination; $3,500 to pass the entry box and an addition al $4,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $2,500 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided accordingly $275,000 to the winner, $100, 000 to second, $60,000 to third, $30,000 to fourth, $20,000 to fifth and $15,000 divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of two Grade One sweepstakes at a mile or over in 2022-23 allowed 2 lbs.; of such a race in 2022 -23 allowed 4 lbs.; of a Graded sweepstake at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey. Closed Saturday, August 12, 2023 with 13 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IDIOMATIC was bumped at the start then coaxed to the front, showed the way while well rated from the inside to the two path, controlled the action going around the far turn, responded well when asked in the three path at the quarter-pole, was put to a right-handed crop outside the furlong marker, drifted in while shaking off NEST inside the furlong marker, drifted out from a left-handed crop while drawing off late and proved much the best. SECRET OATH was rated off the pace while saving ground, came under urging near the five-sixteenths, turned into the stretch in the two path, pursued the winner under a drive and proved no match but finished with good courage to get the place. NEST brushed the outside of the gate at the start, went four wide on the first turn, settled comfortably on the outside, traveled four wide on the far turn, came under some urging near the five-sixteenths, made a bid while roused five wide into the stretch, lost touch with the winner inside the furlong marker, moved in behind that foe late and just lost the place while well clear for the show. MALLOY broke in and bumped with a rival, went two to three wide on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, was asked in the two path between horses on the far turn, chased three wide into the stretch and tired. CLAIRIERE rounded the first turn in the four path under coaxing, settled at the rear on the outside, was roused late on the backstretch, traveled four wide while urged along on the far turn, was driven five wide into the stretch and failed to respond. SIXTYTHREECALIBER was hustled from the gate, raced three wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was asked near the half-mile pole, dropped from the three path to the rail on the far turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Idiomatic
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,coaxd to front,well ratd ins-2p,ask3p1/4,respond,drw off

ENTRY.NAME: Malloy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,bmpd,2-3p1st,tracked,ask 2p2nd,chased,3p1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Oath
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside,asked5/16,2path1/4,chased,good courage,earned2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Sixtythreecaliber
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,3p1st,settled,ask1/2,3p-ins 2nd turn,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Nest
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and House Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd gate,4p1st,settld out,4w2nd,ask5/16,5w1/4,no match,lost2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Clairiere
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w1st,settled outside,roused1/2,urged 4w2nd,5w1/4,no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Ste wards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHITE CHOCOLATE coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, drew clear under a drive and was ridden out to the finish. ARRASOU four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one and ran on to just preserve the place honors on the wire. RISK FREE coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside from the tail of the field, tipped out three wide at the three-eighths placed to coaxing, went eight wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly just missing for the place honors at the finish. MILLIE JEAN lost her rear footing at the start, chased five then four wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, swung five wide into upper stretch and weakened. GOING THE DISTANCE stumbled at the start and was bumped between foes but only conceded a length to the front, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and weakened. BOURBON AND HONEY broke out at the start, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, tired and was eased home to the finish. FRAU DIABLO coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch, tired, and was eased home through to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Frau Diablo
ENTRY.OWNER: Ocean Way Stables Al Bianchi Racing LLC and Oringer Jay
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, tired, eased home

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, tipped 3w 3/8, 8w upper, belatedly

ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled, bumped btw st, chased 4-3w, 4w upper, weakened
